lead_paragraph: The four-time All-Star Jeff Bagwell’s career with the Houston Astros is over after the team declined to exercise its 2007 option on his contract. The Astros will pay a buyout of $7 million to Bagwell, who missed the 2006 season and much of the 2005 season with a degenerative arthritic condition in his right shoulder. Bagwell, 38, is likely to retire, although no announcement is imminent, his agent, Barry Axelrod, said.
